segment.source: This topic contains a brief overview about the accounts and groups, log files, and other security-related considerations for Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM).
segment.target: This topic contains a brief overview about the accounts and groups, log files, and other security-related considerations for Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM).

segment.source: For more information, follow the links within this article.
segment.target: For more information, follow the links within this article.

segment.source: General Security Considerations
segment.target: General Security Considerations

segment.source: Understand the security risks.
segment.target: Understand the security risks.

segment.source: The most serious risk from Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring is that its functionality could be hijacked by an unauthorized user who could then reconfigure BitLocker encryption and gain BitLocker encryption key data on MBAM Clients.
segment.target: The most serious risk from Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring is that its functionality could be hijacked by an unauthorized user who could then reconfigure BitLocker encryption and gain BitLocker encryption key data on MBAM Clients.

segment.source: However, the loss of MBAM functionality for a short period of time, due to a denial-of-service attack, does not generally have a catastrophic impact, unlike, for example, e-mail, network communications, light, and power.
segment.target: However, the loss of MBAM functionality for a short period of time, due to a denial-of-service attack, does not generally have a catastrophic impact, unlike, for example, e-mail, network communications, light, and power.

segment.source: Physically secure your computers.
segment.target: Physically secure your computers.

segment.source: There is no security without physical security.
segment.target: There is no security without physical security.

segment.source: An attacker who gets physical access to an MBAM Server could potentially use it to attack the entire client base.
segment.target: An attacker who gets physical access to an MBAM Server could potentially use it to attack the entire client base.

segment.source: All potential physical attacks must be considered high risk and mitigated appropriately.
segment.target: All potential physical attacks must be considered high risk and mitigated appropriately.

segment.source: MBAM servers should be stored in a secure server room with controlled access.
segment.target: MBAM servers should be stored in a secure server room with controlled access.

segment.source: Secure these computers when administrators are not physically present by having the operating system lock the computer, or by using a secured screen saver.
segment.target: Secure these computers when administrators are not physically present by having the operating system lock the computer, or by using a secured screen saver.

segment.source: Apply the most recent security updates to all computers.
segment.target: Apply the most recent security updates to all computers.

segment.source: Stay informed about new updates for operating systems, Microsoft SQL Server, and MBAM by subscribing to the Security Notification service (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=28819).
segment.target: Stay informed about new updates for operating systems, Microsoft SQL Server, and MBAM by subscribing to the Security Notification service (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=28819).

segment.source: Use strong passwords or pass phrases.
segment.target: Use strong passwords or pass phrases.

segment.source: Always use strong passwords with 15 or more characters for all MBAM and MBAM administrator accounts.
segment.target: Always use strong passwords with 15 or more characters for all MBAM and MBAM administrator accounts.

segment.source: Never use blank passwords.
segment.target: Never use blank passwords.

segment.source: For more information about password concepts, see the “Account Passwords and Policies” white paper on TechNet (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=30009).
segment.target: For more information about password concepts, see the “Account Passwords and Policies” white paper on TechNet (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=30009).

segment.source: Accounts and Groups in MBAM
segment.target: Accounts and Groups in MBAM

segment.source: The best practice for managing user accounts is to create domain global groups and add user accounts to them.
segment.target: The best practice for managing user accounts is to create domain global groups and add user accounts to them.

segment.source: Then, add the domain global accounts to the necessary MBAM local groups on the MBAM Servers.
segment.target: Then, add the domain global accounts to the necessary MBAM local groups on the MBAM Servers.

segment.source: MBAM Database TDE Considerations
segment.target: MBAM Database TDE Considerations

segment.source: The transparent data encryption (TDE) feature that is available in SQL Server is an optional installation for the database instances that will host MBAM database features.
segment.target: The transparent data encryption (TDE) feature that is available in SQL Server is an optional installation for the database instances that will host MBAM database features.

segment.source: With TDE, you can perform real-time, full database-level encryption.
segment.target: With TDE, you can perform real-time, full database-level encryption.

segment.source: TDE is the optimal choice for bulk encryption to meet regulatory compliance or corporate data security standards.
segment.target: TDE is the optimal choice for bulk encryption to meet regulatory compliance or corporate data security standards.

segment.source: TDE works at the file level, which is similar to two Windows features: the Encrypting File System (EFS) and BitLocker Drive Encryption, both of which also encrypt data on the hard drive.
segment.target: TDE works at the file level, which is similar to two Windows features: the Encrypting File System (EFS) and BitLocker Drive Encryption, both of which also encrypt data on the hard drive.

segment.source: TDE does not replace cell-level encryption, EFS, or BitLocker.
segment.target: TDE does not replace cell-level encryption, EFS, or BitLocker.

segment.source: When TDE is enabled on a database, all backups are encrypted.
segment.target: When TDE is enabled on a database, all backups are encrypted.

segment.source: Thus, special care must be taken to ensure that the certificate that was used to protect the database encryption key is backed up and maintained with the database backup.
segment.target: Thus, special care must be taken to ensure that the certificate that was used to protect the database encryption key is backed up and maintained with the database backup.

segment.source: If this certificate (or certificates) is lost, the data will be unreadable.
segment.target: If this certificate (or certificates) is lost, the data will be unreadable.

segment.source: Back up the certificate along with the database.
segment.target: Back up the certificate along with the database.

segment.source: Each certificate backup should have two files.
segment.target: Each certificate backup should have two files.

segment.source: Both of these files should be archived (ideally separately from the database backup file for security).
segment.target: Both of these files should be archived (ideally separately from the database backup file for security).

segment.source: You can alternatively consider using the extensible key management (EKM) feature (see Extensible Key Management) for storage and maintenance of keys used for TDE.
segment.target: You can alternatively consider using the extensible key management (EKM) feature (see Extensible Key Management) for storage and maintenance of keys used for TDE.

segment.source: For an example of how to enable TDE for MBAM database instances, see Evaluating MBAM 2.0.
segment.target: For an example of how to enable TDE for MBAM database instances, see Evaluating MBAM 2.0.

segment.source: For more information about TDE in SQL Server 2008, see SQL Server Encryption.
segment.target: For more information about TDE in SQL Server 2008, see SQL Server Encryption.
